column4: I've got a USB KVM switch - and every time I switch, I feel like I'm being traumatic to the poor system - cpu spikes, tons of junk gets thrown to /var/log/messages, the whole machine slows down for a few seconds...  Why does all this happen?
Indeed it's traumatic. I'd suggest to limit its use. The more if it's a mechanical switch.
and as long as you are switching mouse and keyboard too, I suppose it will show in logs.
So ... in the world of USB, the kvm no longer is viable?
